etymologies: early 19th century: from Italian, from Latin studium (see study)

definitions: a room where an artist, photographer, sculptor, etc. works

examples.text: mostly the painting is done in the studio, working from drawings

shortDefinitions: room where artist, photographer, sculptor, etc. works

definitions: a place where movies are made or produced.
shortDefinitions: place where cinema films are made or produced

definitions: a room where musical or sound recordings can be made

examples.text: the Department of Music has a professional recording studio

shortDefinitions: place where musical or sound recordings are made

definitions: a room from which television or radio programs are broadcast, or in which they are recorded

examples.text: the broadcasts will be transmitted from the Middlesbrough studios

shortDefinitions: room from which television programmes are broadcast, or in which they are recorded

definitions: a place where performers, especially dancers, practice and exercise

examples.text: its dance studio is spacious enough to cater for aerobics classes

shortDefinitions: place where performers practise and exercise

definitions: a film or television production company

examples.text: the big names are being snapped up by major studios in the film capital
a big-budget contract with a major studio
all apartments and studios have private facilities
